column3: Create new session and record messages
column4: Verify user messages and AI responses are recorded chronologically in a new session.
column5: User logged in; no active sessions.
column6: Short user question; model default response.
column7: Open a new session; send a message; verify it appears in history; wait for AI response and verify it's recorded.
column8: Message and response are saved and displayed in chronological order.

column3: Close session / open new; ensure separation
column4: Verify sessions remain separate and histories do not mix.
column5: An active session exists with at least two messages.
column7: Close active session; open a new session; send a message; verify previous session history is not shown.
column8: Each session maintains its own separate history without leakage.

column4: Validate text/tag search within session history.
column5: Multiple sessions with varied content exist.
column7: Search by text; search by tag; review matched items.
column8: Matching sessions/messages are displayed accurately with highlights/counts.

column4: Ensure an archived session can be opened and interaction continued.
column7: Open session from archive; send a new message.
column8: Existing history loads; new message is appended without errors.

column4: Verify proper deletion with confirmation and absence from listings/search.
column7: Click delete; confirm in popup; attempt to find session via list/search.
column8: Session no longer appears anywhere.

column4: Ensure successful upload and preview/metadata shown.
column7: Drag/select PNG; observe progress; verify completion; open file details.
column8: Upload succeeds; name, size, date shown; file usable.

column4: Verify PDF support including preview/extract text.
column7: Upload PDF; open preview; test text extraction if supported.
column8: Upload and preview work; text is accessible without encoding issues.

column4: Ensure Word/PPT are supported and Excel is blocked with friendly error.
column7: Upload DOCX (expect success); upload PPTX (expect success); upload XLSX (expect block).
column8: Excel is blocked with a clear error; DOCX/PPTX succeed.

column4: Support text-based formats and correct encoding.
column6: CSV (UTF-8) with Hebrew; JSON valid; TXT in Hebrew.
column7: Upload each file; verify type detection and content rendering.
column8: Files are ingested correctly; content displayed without broken encoding.

column4: Validate queue/progress and concurrent multi-file upload.
column7: Select all files together; observe progress; verify individual statuses.
column8: All files upload; any per-file errors are shown independently; no UI freeze.

column4: Verify blocking with clear guidance when size limit exceeded.
column7: Attempt to upload; observe error message.
column8: Upload is blocked; friendly error message with next steps.

column4: Validate handling of file name characters and normalization.
column7: Attempt to upload each; verify acceptance/block and normalization.
column8: Illegal characters blocked; Hebrew/emoji supported or normalized per policy.

column4: Ensure proper display for Hebrew text and CSV.
column6: CSV with Hebrew; TXT with diacritics.
column7: Upload; open preview; scan for broken characters.
column8: Content displays correctly without squares/garbled text.

column4: Verify cancel behavior and logging; no partial files remain.
column6: Large file to trigger long upload.
column7: Start upload; click cancel midway; check status and storage.
column8: Status shows 'Cancelled'; no partial artifact stored; event logged.

column4: Verify CRUD operations for folders and files.
column5: User logged in with edit permissions.
column7: Create folder; move a file into it; rename folder and file.
column8: Operations succeed; audit log records actions; navigation remains consistent.

column4: Verify deletion respects permissions and recovery flow.
column5: Accounts with Admin and Viewer roles available.
column7: Attempt delete as Viewer (expect block); delete as Admin; restore via recycle if available.
column8: Permission policy enforced; full audit trail; recovery restores original state.

column4: Create a predefined Collection with many files/folders.
column5: User logged in; several files/folders exist.
column7: Create Collection; add numerous items; save.
column8: Collection saved and available for selection in queries.

column4: Validate context injection from a Collection into an AI query.
column6: A question whose answer is present in the Collection.
column7: Select the Collection; ask the question; review citations/attribution.
column8: Answer relies on the Collection content; sources/citations are shown as designed.

column4: Verify management capabilities for finding and organizing files.
column5: User logged in; files with varied metadata exist.
column7: Search by type/date/size; apply filters; sort ascending/descending.
column8: Results match criteria consistently without anomalies.

column4: Validate sharing enforcement for Collections.
column7: Share Collection with a user/group; verify access from their account.
column8: Only authorized principals can access; unauthorized are blocked with clear messaging.

column4: Create a prompt with name/category/description and verify availability.
column7: Fill details; save; verify in list; open details.
column8: Prompt is saved and available for use.

column4: Verify versioning and ability to restore a prior version.
column7: Edit prompt; create a new version; restore previous version.
column8: Version history is maintained; restore works.

column4: Apply a saved Prompt to a session and observe impact on responses.
column7: Select Prompt; open session; ask question; compare to baseline.
column8: Responses follow the prompt style/constraints.

column4: Locate prompts by name/creator/date and validate metadata display.
column6: Search keyword; creator name; date range.
column7: Search and filter; review metadata fields.
column8: Accurate results and correct metadata fields shown.

column4: Validate maintenance actions and permission enforcement.
column5: Prompt exists; sharing feature enabled (if applicable).
column7: Delete a prompt; share with a user; export if supported.
column8: Actions performed with audit logging; permissions enforced.

column4: Define a preset including model, prompt, and environment settings.
column5: User logged in; available models listed.
column6: Model name; prompt text; temperature; max tokens; toggles.
column7: Fill fields; save; verify appearance and correctness of values.
column8: Preset is saved and usable; values persisted.

column4: Ensure preset settings are loaded when activated in a session.
column7: Select preset; open session; ask question; compare with baseline.
column8: Model and settings applied; observable differences as expected.

column3: Update Preset and apply to active session
column4: Verify updates to a preset are reflected in an ongoing session.
column7: Update preset values; apply to the active session; ask same question.
column8: New settings influence responses immediately or per design.

column4: Validate management of many presets and prevention of duplicates.
column7: Create multiple presets; attempt duplicate name; search and sort presets.
column8: Duplicate prevented or warned; search returns expected items.

column4: Ensure the model selection menu lists available models and loads them.
column7: Open model menu; browse; select a model.
column8: Model loads without error; ready for queries.

column4: Verify that changing parameters affects responses.
column6: Same question asked twice with different settings.
column7: Adjust temperature and max tokens; ask the same question; compare outputs.
column8: Observable differences matching parameter changes.

column4: Confirm default model is used when none is selected explicitly.
column7: Open new session; ask a question; inspect which model is used.
column8: Default model is applied per configuration.

column4: Verify error messaging and fallback when a model is unavailable.
column7: Select an unavailable model; observe error and offered alternatives.
column8: Clear error; suggested fallback; system remains stable.

column4: Confirm web search is enabled by default for new sessions.
column6: A question likely requiring web context.
column7: Open a new session; ask question; check UI flag and response references.
column8: Web search is active; sources/references included as designed.

column4: Validate differences in quality and sources when web search toggled.
column5: Session with ability to toggle search.
column7: Ask with search on; turn off; ask again; compare outputs.
column8: With search on: richer references; with off: model-only context; differences documented.

column4: Ensure per-session and global toggles behave as expected.
column7: Disable in the current session; enable globally; verify behaviors across sessions.
column8: Settings respected per scope; UI reflects correct state.

column4: Validate messages and logging under rate limits/outages.
column5: Ability to simulate load or observe in staging.
column7: Trigger many queries; monitor for rate-limit errors; inspect logs.
column8: Informative messages shown; retries/backoff handled; logs capture events.

column4: Verify stages: gather, analyze, cite.
column7: Start deep research; observe stages; review final output.
column8: Stages visible; final output includes citations/explanations.

column4: Ensure cancellation leaves system stable and restartable.
column7: Start; cancel midway; check logs; start a new run.
column8: No orphaned state; logs reflect cancel; new run starts cleanly.

column4: Validate OAuth/Graph scopes and connectivity.
column7: Configure connection; verify token acquisition; list accessible libraries.
column8: Valid token; accessible resources listed; no permission errors.

column4: Ensure document access within authorized libraries.
column7: Search documents; open/download; verify source attribution.
column8: Only authorized documents accessible; correct source references.

column4: Validate ACLs are enforced for users/groups.
column7: Attempt restricted access with unauthorized user; observe messaging.
column8: Access denied with clear message; audit recorded.

column4: Ensure answers cite KB sources when applicable.
column6: Question whose answer resides in KB.
column7: Ask question; review citations and links to KB sources.
column8: Answer includes clear attribution to KB sources.

column3: Handle messages including the message history
column7: Attempt to open the missing item; observe error and logs.
column8: Clear error shown; logs contain correlation info.

column3: Average response time for regular queries
column4: Measure SLA for standard queries.
column7: Send 20 queries; record response times; compute average and anomalies.
column8: Average is within SLA; outliers documented.

column4: Assess upload performance under concurrent load.
column7: Start concurrent uploads; track success/failure; monitor UI responsiveness.
column8: High success rate; no freezes; errors handled individually.

column4: Verify time/resource usage on big datasets.
column7: Run deep research over the large Collection; measure duration and resource usage.
column8: Does not exceed configured thresholds; informative progress shown.

column4: Validate UI performance and memory handling for very large Collections.
column7: Load, browse, and search within the large Collection.
column8: UI remains responsive; no crashes; operations complete within reasonable time.

column4: Validate role-based access controls for actions.
column7: Attempt actions per role; verify allowed/blocked operations.
column8: Policy consistently enforced; unauthorized actions blocked and logged.

column4: Detect and neutralize malicious prompt instructions.
column5: Feature enabled; test malicious prompts available.
column7: Submit malicious prompt; observe system behavior and any guardrails.
column8: No leakage or execution of disallowed instructions; warnings/logging present.

column4: Validate TLS and storage encryption.
column5: Access to configuration and monitoring tools.
column7: Inspect TLS configuration; verify storage encryption settings/certificates.
column8: TLS is enabled; storage encrypted as per policy.

column4: Ensure consent screens and usage logging are present and captured.
column7: Open consent screen; accept; verify audit and policy display.
column8: Consent recorded with audit trail; policies accessible.

column4: Prevent exposure of PII in responses/logs.
column5: Feature enabled; test data with PII.
column7: Ask question that might surface PII; inspect response and logs.
column8: PII masked/omitted per policy in UI and logs.

column4: Validate clarity, brevity, and localization of error messages.
column7: Trigger an upload error; capture the message; assess clarity/translation.
column8: Message understandable, localized, and actionable.

column4: Ensure progress indicators appear for uploads/analysis.
column7: Start upload/analysis; observe progress bar/spinner with percentages.
column8: Accurate progress reflects task state; no misleading values.

column4: Validate right-to-left layout and keyboard shortcuts.
column7: Switch to Hebrew; verify RTL alignment; test keyboard shortcuts.
column8: Layout correct; shortcuts function; no broken UI.

column4: Validate basic WCAG compliance.
column7: Check focus order; alt descriptions; contrast ratios; tab navigation.
column8: Meets minimum WCAG targets; navigable without mouse.

column4: Show error and allow retry.
column5: Environment where failure can be simulated.
column7: Force an upload failure; click Retry; verify outcome.
column8: Retry mechanism works; errors are transparent and logged.

column4: Present error and suggest alternative.
column7: Select disabled model; observe messaging and alternative suggestion.
column8: Helpful error shown; alternative offered; app remains stable.

column4: Provide detailed log with correlation ID for supportability.
column7: Trigger an API exception; inspect logs and surfaced ID.
column8: Correlation ID present; details sufficient for troubleshooting.

column4: Graceful cancel and state preservation.
column7: Cause a timeout; verify cancel behavior and ability to resume.
column8: State preserved or reset per design; user can retry.

column4: Ensure audit trail records key actions.
column7: Perform actions; open audit view; inspect entries.
column8: All events recorded with timestamps and actor IDs.

column4: Validate presence of essential metadata in logs.
column7: Open log entry; verify session ID, time, user, source fields.
column8: All required fields present and accurate.

column4: Ensure error alerts appear in monitoring UI.
column7: Trigger an error; verify alert appears; check severity and details.
column8: Alert created with appropriate severity and information.

column4: Validate export functionality and schema.
column7: Export logs to CSV and JSON; open files; verify schema.
column8: Files load in BI tools; fields correct; no encoding issues.

column4: Validate session, upload, and feature usage metrics.
column7: Open analytics dashboard; verify counts and trends.
column8: Data consistent across views and time ranges.

column4: Validate filters for department/user segmentation.
column7: Apply filters; review segmented results.
column8: Results reflect correct segmentation.

column4: Ensure correct calculation of runtime/accuracy/success rates.
column7: Run multiple queries; inspect KPI calculations.
column8: KPIs computed per definition; dashboards show correct values.

column4: Verify core flows function across major browsers.
column7: Execute key flows (upload, query, deep research) in each browser.
column8: No critical differences or errors across browsers.

column4: Validate system compatibility with varied file name conventions.
column5: Feature to normalize names enabled (if applicable).
column6: Names with spaces, Hebrew, emoji, and reserved characters.
column7: Upload and manage files with diverse names; observe behavior.
column8: Supported names accepted; illegal names blocked or normalized.

column4: Validate triggers and payload schema for integrations.
column7: Trigger webhook; capture payload; validate against schema.
column8: Payload matches schema; downstream consumes successfully.

column4: Create snapshot/export and verify contents.
column7: Run backup; locate backup files; inspect completeness.
column8: Backup contains all expected items; readable and intact.

column4: Restore data ensuring integrity.
column7: Restore a single item; perform full restore; compare to pre-backup state.
column8: No data loss; restored items match originals.

column4: Validate RBAC across roles.
column7: Test actions per role (create, delete, share); observe enforcement.
column8: RBAC enforced; unauthorized actions blocked and logged.

column4: Set and enforce policies for upload size and allowed types.
column7: Define policy; attempt violating uploads; observe enforcement.
column8: Violations blocked; messages clear; audit recorded.

column4: Map permissions for SharePoint/external sources.
column7: Update mapping; verify access limits and availability.
column8: Changes take effect; access behaves per new mapping.
